title: multiple file zip generation fails for big archives.
body:
whenever the multiple-file-download function in the files app of oc tries to generate a zip for download, which is bigger than ~8mb, it returns an empty file for the download instead of the zip.
the number of the files seems to be irrelevant.

update (using the template):

### expected behaviour
oc creates a valid zip file and the browser downloads it.

### actual behaviour
oc creates an empty file (0b) with zip-extension and the browser downloads it.

### steps to reproduce
1. place multiple files with an overall size of >>8mb in a folder of your oc 
2. try to download the folder with the web interface
3. examine the file.

### server configuration
operating system: ubuntu 12.10

web server: lighttpd 1.4.28

database: sqlite3

php version: 5.4.6

owncloud version: 4.5.6

### client configuration
browser: firefox 18 / chromium 23.0.1271.97

operating system: ubuntu 12.10

### logs
#### web server error log (excerpt)
==> /var/log/lighttpd/access.log <==
ip host - [30/jan/2013:17:58:17 +0100] "get /owncloud/?app=files&getfile=ajax/download.php&files=familie&dir=%2ffotos http/1.1" 200 0 "https://host/owncloud/?app=files&dir=//fotos" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; ubuntu; linux x86_64; rv:18.0) gecko/20100101 firefox/18.0"

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log) (excerpt)
{"app":"core","message":"oc_image->loadfromfile, default","level":0,"time":1359497453}
(repeatedly)

#### browser log
##### firefox:
no chrome package registered for chrome://dta-modules/content/support/filtermanager.js
##### chromium:
resource interpreted as document but transferred with mime type application/zip: "https://host/owncloud/?app=files&getfile=ajax/download.php&files=familie&dir=%2ffotos".


i hope, thats enough information. please tell me if anything is missing.
the problem also occured with earlier versions of the os (server and client), the webserver, php, oc itself and the browsers.
